column1: Fenmarch was a region of eastern Rohan that stretched from the Firienholt along the Mering Stream
column2: and therefore marked part of Rohans eastern border with Gondor.

column1: The fen element of the name means "marsh" and is a reference to the wetlands along the Mering Stream. March is an old word for "borderland" - a reference to the border with An√≥rien - and has the same derivation as Riddermark
column2: a name for the whole country of Rohan.

column1: Note that J.R.R. Tolkien writes that on reflection he would have preferred the form "Fenmark"
column2: to the extent that he recommended this alternative version for translated versions of the book.
